      job_description:
        "SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.\n\nSOFTWARE ENGINEER (STARSHIELD) - TOP SECRET CLEARANCE\n\nStarshield leverages SpaceX\u2019s Starlink technology and launch capability to support national security efforts. While Starlink is designed for consumer and commercial use, Starshield is designed for government use, with an initial focus on earth observation, communications, and hosted payloads.\n\nThe Starshield software team is building highly reliable in-space mesh networks, designing secure systems to guarantee access to space, designing next-gen communication and sensing software, and more. Aerospace experience is not required to be successful here - we want our engineers to bring fresh ideas from all areas. We look for engineers who love solving problems and seek to make an impact on an inspiring mission. As we expand this team, we're looking for versatile, motivated, and collaborative engineers.\n\nOur team is involved in designing the vehicle systems at every phase of development. We build tools that enable us to work more efficiently, and that help us build software systems that are secure, reliable, and autonomous. Our software engineers are responsible for the life cycle of the software they create, including development, testing, and operational support.\n\nRESPONSIBILITIES:\n\u2022 Create highly reliable software systems that control hundreds of satellites in low earth orbit\n\u2022 Leverage software design to improve satellite constellation performance, security, and availability to meet the needs of a wide range of users\n\u2022 See your software through from start to finish: from figuring out the core needs to prototyping, developing, and testing; to on-orbit rollout and beyond\n\u2022 Work with interdisciplinary teams to brainstorm, design, and build the next generation of satellite capabilities, from cutting-edge sensors and inter-satellite lasers to space-based cloud compute\n\nThere are several roles within the Starshield software team with different focus areas. Applicants will interview for specific focus areas based on hiring needs and qualifications. Specific role responsibilities may include:\n\u2022 Write high quality Linux-based C++ software for common processors and micro controllers (e.g. ARM, PowerPC, x86, etc.)\n\u2022 Implement networking technologies to direct data across a variety of satellites, ground operations centers, and users\n\u2022 Build automated ground-based software systems that integrate smart data processing with command and control of the satellites\n\u2022 Develop models and simulations for flight-like vehicle software testing, network performance analysis, or research & development projects\n\u2022 Develop tools that allow for test execution across multiple environments: virtualized hardware, real hardware-in-the-loop, and even vehicle-in-the-loop testing\n\u2022 Invent new systems that enable more frequent and reliable software deployment, test execution, and data analysis as part of a continuous integration and release system\n\nBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:\n\u2022 Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, math, or STEM discipline; OR 2+\u202fyears of professional experience in\u202fsoftware development in lieu of a degree\n\u2022 Development experience in C, C++, or Python or full stack software development experience\n\u2022 Active Top Secret, Top Secret SCI, or DOE Level Q clearance\n\nPREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:\n\u2022 Developed and deployed software that has been used real-world applications and projects\n\u2022 Solid fundamental knowledge of computer architecture and networks\n\u2022 Strong skills in debugging, performance optimization and unit testing\n\u2022 Ability to work effectively and creatively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirements\n\u2022 Ability to work independently and in a team, take initiative, and communicate effectively\n\u2022 Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret or Top Secret SCI clearance\n\nSome preferred skills and experience depend on the specific team within flight software and may include:\n\u2022 Experience with networking protocols (TCP, UDP, etc)\n\u2022 Experience developing in the Linux kernel\n\u2022 Experience in C++ for high performance systems\n\u2022 Experience with image data processing and machine learning\n\u2022 Strong background in math and physics\n\nADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:\n\u2022 Note that an active clearance may provide the opportunity for you to work on sensitive SpaceX missions; if so, you will be subject to pre-employment drug and random drug and alcohol testing\n\u2022 Must be willing to work extended hours and weekends as needed\n\nCOMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:\n\nPay Range:\nSoftware Engineer/Level I: $120,000.00 - $145,000.00/per year\nSoftware Engineer/Level II: $140,000.00 - $170,000.00/per year\n\nYour actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.\n\nBase salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. The exposure to multiple industries and aspects of technology presents an ideal environment in which you can continue to master your trade skills, as well as be exposed to many developing technologies & interesting problem spaces.\n\nAdditionally, we encourage the inter-communication and mingling of our employees \u2013 to include company sponsored vacations, quarterly \u2018cast away\u2019 weeks where we co-locate our employees to further collaborate, and many social functions and internal interest groups.\n\nWe are headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, with remote employees across the nation: Las Vegas, Washington D.C., Austin, Dallas, Portland, Green Bay, Kansas City, Minneapolis, and Orlando, just to name a few.\n\nWhat is Aviture\u2019s Art of the Possible?\n\nAlong with our mission-driven team\u2019s deep expertise in a wide range of development languages, we employ a disciplined agile approach to define goals upfront, keep organizational value at the forefront, and set the pace for rapid, iterative innovation that transforms organizations. We call this the Art of the Possible.\n\nThe solutions we\u2019ve created have:\n\u2022 Saved lives in the California wildfires and southern U.S. flooding\n\u2022 Provided security for the 2020 Presidential Inauguration, Super Bowl, and post-attack Boston Marathon\n\u2022 Enabled augmented-reality training environments for surgeons\n\u2022 Increased transparency and promoted patient wellness in hospitals and senior care facilities\n\u2022 Combined computer vision and robotics to automate dangerous manual labor tasks\n\u2022 And much more!\n\nWhy You\u2019ll Want to Live Aviturian\n\nAviturians create technology that makes a meaningful difference in someone\u2019s life. If that sounds like something you\u2019d like to be a part of, then join us today!\n\nSenior Software Engineer\n\nAviture is currently hiring a Senior Software Engineer to join our team and support the continued development of the United States Air Force\u2019s primary recruiting and public-facing application \u2013 Aim High. If hired, you will be contributing to a platform which sets aspiring individuals on a path for career growth and personal development, provides viable options for education and a lucrative future for those typically underserved, and help connect families to loved ones as they enter a career in the US Air Force.\n\nThis role involves working as a part of a mature, cross functional, agile development team with generalized specializations in UX, UI, Mobile, Cloud Engineering (AWS), DevOps and QA. The ideal candidate should have deep experience working on professional level mobile applications with mature cloud-hosted backends. The specific stack being used is React Native, Expo, AWS with a serverless paradigm, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, React.js, Strapi, React Native Testing Library, and Appium \u2013 the greater exposure to these frameworks the better.\n\nWe\u2019re looking for a Senior Software Engineer who will\u2026\n\u2022 Deliver solutions to complex technical challenges both independently and as a part of a cross-functional team.\n\u2022 Communicate clearly in a timely manner in both verbal and written forms.\n\u2022 Actively participate in all aspects of our agile development process.\n\u2022 Assist in establishing and enforcing coding standards within their team.\n\u2022 Work with project stakeholders to decompose complex requirements into smaller sets of iterative deliverables.\n\u2022 Recognize and recommend design patterns for developing reliable, highly available, scalable and performant software solutions.\n\u2022 Identify opportunities to improve upon engineering processes within their team.\n\u2022 Provide technical mentorship and direction to peers.\n\u2022 Utilize effective debugging techniques to identify and resolve software defects.\n\u2022 Look beyond the immediate needs of a product and help consider longer-term concerns and/or opportunities for impact from our products.\n\u2022 Continuously keep themselves up to date on changes in technology, with an emphasis on the tech stacks being used by your team.\n\u2022 BS degree in Software Engineering related degree, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.\n\u2022 7+ years of professional software development experience building and shipping production grade software or services.\n\u2022 Advanced knowledge of software testing tools, frameworks, and techniques.\n\u2022 Proficient in at least two modern programming languages (Python, Java, C#/.NET, Go, JavaScript, TypeScript).\n\u2022 Excellent verbal and written communication skills. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.         "Job Details\nLevel: Experienced\nJob Location: Undisclosed\nSalary Range: Undisclosed\nDescription\n\nInterested in mentoring others and driving software innovation in the utility sector? help define product architecture and implement secure, reliable, scalable software products\n\u2022 Collaborate with internal and client stakeholders to translate business problems into technical solutions\n\u2022 Mentor junior software engineers on best practices for building scalable cloud applications\n\u2022 Participate in continuous learning activities to understand latest technology trends and share knowledge across the team and organization\n\nWhat will make you a good fit\n\u2022 At least 5 years of experience in Java (11 or 17+) software development\n\u2022 Knowledge or experience architecting software solutions within the AWS Cloud Platform\n\u2022 Experience with data modeling and relational database design and implementation\n\u2022 Experience with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB and Cassandra\n\u2022 Experience with enterprise integration patterns and creating and managing microservices in a containerized environment (Spring Boot, Docker, and Kubernetes)\n\u2022 Experience with knowledge graph technologies and techniques\n\u2022 Experience programming with Python\n\u2022 Experience working with GIT and GITOPS, and building CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins or AWS code pipelines\n\u2022 Product-oriented mindset\n\u2022 Proven track record of efficiently designing, developing, and releasing software products both independently and collaboratively\n\u2022 Creative mind, keen ability, and the initiative to think beyond\n\u2022 Ability to effectively communicate with technical teams and business stakeholders\n\u2022 Passion for energy and the environment\n\u2022 BS or MS in software engineering, computer science, or a related field of study\n\nA little about E Source\n\nSince 1986, E Source has focused on partnering with       job_description:
        "Company Description\n\nDropbox is a special place where we are all seeking to fulfill our mission to design a more enlightened way of working. We\u2019re looking for innovative talent to join us on our journey. The words shared by our founders at the start of Dropbox still ring true today.\n\nWouldn\u2019t it be great if our working environment\u2014and the tools we use\u2014were designed with people\u2019s actual needs in mind? Imagine if every minute at work were well spent\u2014if we could focus and spend our time on the things that matter. This is possible, and Dropbox is connecting the dots.\n\nThe nearly 3,000 Dropboxers around the world have helped make Dropbox a living workspace - the place where people come together and their ideas come to life. Our 700+ million global users have been some of our best salespeople, and they have helped us acquire customers with incredible efficiency. As a result, we reached a billion dollar revenue run rate faster than any software-as-a-service company in history.\n\nDropbox is making the dream of a fulfilling and seamless work life a reality. We hope you\u2019ll join us on the journey.\n\nTeam Description\n\nOur Engineering team is working to simplify the way people work together. They\u2019re building a family of products that handle over a billion files a day for people around the world. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact.\n\nRole Description\n\nOur strategy starts with our mission: how do we build the right set of products that can help our customers work in a more enlightened way? If the first big problem Dropbox solved was getting your files in the cloud, the new problem we\u2019re solving is helping you organize your life.\nAs we\u2019re evolving the core business from syncing and sharing files, we are looking for Software Engineers to come build the next generation of new products for collaboration and distributed work. Product Engineers thrive working across technologies and codebases, but are also involved in various product development cycle stages.
